name: First sunrise and awakening of Men
description: First sunrise. Fingolfin's arrival in Middle-earth. Awakening of Men in Hildórien. At this time Morgoth attacks Tilion, the helmsman of the Moon, with spirits of shadow. Tilion wins the battle in Ilmen, but the Valar fear that Morgoth will not rest and will try to destroy Valinor just as he did Almaren. Therefore they pile up the Pelóri to even greater heights, fortify the Calacirya, the only pass in this mountain range, with defensive towers and surround Tol Eressëa with the Enchanted Isles: the Hiding of Valinor.

name: Fingolfin moves to Mithrim
description: Fingolfin moves to Mithrim.

name: Maedhros freed from Thangorodrim
description: Maedhros is freed from Thangorodrim by Fingon and loses his right hand in the process.

name: Beleriand explored by the Noldor
description: All of Beleriand is now explored by the Noldor.

name: Fingolfin becomes High King
description: Fingolfin is appointed High King by the Noldor.

name: Mereth Aderthad
description: Fingolfin holds the Mereth Aderthad.

name: Journey of Turgon and Finrod
description: Journey of Turgon and Finrod.

name: Construction of Nargothrond begins
description: Construction of Nargothrond begins.

name: The Dagor Aglareb begins
description: The Dagor Aglareb begins. Angband is besieged by the Noldor-princes.

name: Turgon begins construction of Gondolin
description: Turgon begins the construction of Gondolin.

name: Fortification of Círdan's havens
description: With the help of the Noldor, Círdan fortifies the havens of Eglarest and Brithombar. On the western cape of Eglarest the tower Barad Nimras is erected, which shall serve to watch the sea.

name: Thingol learns of the Silmarils
description: Thingol learns of the Silmarils.

name: Thingol bans the Noldorin language
description: Thingol bans the language of the Noldor after he hears of the Kinslaying.

name: Foundation of Nargothrond
description: Foundation of Nargothrond.

name: Completion of Gondolin
description: Completion of Gondolin. Turgon's people set out for Gondolin.

name: Fingon destroys Morgoth's host
description: Fingon destroys the host that was sent by Morgoth to Hithlum.

name: Defeat of Glaurung and beginning of Long Peace
description: Glaurung devastates Beleriand but is driven away by Fingon. Beginning of the Long Peace.

name: Birth of Beor the Old
description: Birth of Beor the Old.

name: Birth of Marach
description: Birth of Marach.

name: First contact between Elves and Men
description: Finrod Felagund meets Beor the Old and thus the first Men in Ossiriand.

name: Settlement of the Haladin
description: The people of the Haladin settle in Thargelion.

name: Third House of Men reaches Beleriand
description: Under the leadership of Marach, the Third House of Men reaches Beleriand and settles near Estolad.

name: Birth of Boron
description: Birth of Boron.

name: Aredhel abducted by Eöl
description: Aredhel is abducted by Eöl and subsequently takes him as husband. Beldir's birth.

name: Birth of Maeglin
description: Birth of Maeglin in Nan Elmoth.

name: Men leave Estolad
description: The Men leave Estolad and move into the Elven kingdoms.

name: Return of Aredhel and Maeglin to Gondolin
description: Return of Aredhel and Maeglin to Gondolin.

name: Death of Beor the Old
description: Beor the Old dies.

name: Council of Men and Morgoth's servant
description: Council assembly of the Men of the First and Third Houses, whereupon a servant of Morgoth, disguised, holds a speech. With a great host Bereg moves south.

name: Birth of Belemir
description: Birth of Belemir.

name: Attack on Thargelion
description: Thargelion is attacked by Orcs, but they can be driven away by Celegorm and Curufin. In this attack Haldad and Haldar die.

name: Birth of Hador
description: Birth of Hador.

name: Birth of Bregolas
description: Birth of Bregolas.

name: Death of Aredhel
description: Aredhel dies by Eöl's spear, whereupon he is cast from the Caragdûr. Birth of Barahir.

name: Death of Boron
description: Death of Boron.

name: Boromir becomes Lord of Ladros
description: Boromir is appointed by Finrod as Lord of Ladros.

name: Hador becomes Lord of Dor-lómin
description: Hador becomes Lord of Dor-lómin.

name: Birth of Gundor
description: Birth of Gundor.

name: Death of Haleth and birth of twins
description: Haleth dies. Baragund and Belegund are born.

name: Birth of Haldir
description: Birth of Haldir.

name: Birth of Húrin Thalion
description: Birth of Húrin Thalion.

name: Birth of Beren Erchamion
description: Birth of Beren Erchamion.

name: Birth of Huor
description: Birth of Huor.

name: Birth of Gil-galad
description: Birth of Ereinion, later called Gil-galad.

name: Dagor Bragollach
description: Dagor Bragollach. Angrod, Aegnor, Bregolas as well as Hador and his youngest son Gundor fall in battle. Galdor becomes Lord of Dor-lómin. Fingolfin dies in single combat with Morgoth. Breakthrough through the Siege of Angband. Celegorm and Curufin flee to Nargothrond. Húrin and Huor are brought to Gondolin by Thorondor.

name: Return of Húrin and Huor
description: Húrin and Huor return from Gondolin to Dor-lómin.

name: Capture of Minas Tirith
description: Capture of Minas Tirith by Sauron's troops.

name: Death of Barahir and his companions
description: Death of Barahir, Baragund, Belegund and his remaining band by Sauron's troops.

name: Death of Galdor
description: Galdor is killed in the siege of Barad Eithel. Húrin becomes new Lord of Dor-lómin.

name: Birth of Túrin and Beren meets Lúthien
description: Birth of Túrin Turambar. Beren encounters Lúthien. Húrin marries Morwen.

name: Beren departs from Doriath
description: Beren departs from Doriath to conquer a Silmaril.

name: Death of Finrod and freeing of Beren
description: Finrod and Beren are imprisoned in Tol-in-Gaurhoth. Finrod is killed by a werewolf, Beren is freed by Lúthien. Celegorm and Curufin are banished from Nargothrond and travel to Himring.

name: Quest for the Silmaril
description: Beren and Lúthien conquer a Silmaril, which however is devoured by Carcharoth. Beren is mortally wounded.

name: The Wolf-hunt
description: Beginning of the Wolf-hunt and reconquest of the Silmaril. Beren receives a second chance from Mandos thanks to Lúthien and is sent back.

name: Nirnaeth Arnoediad
description: Nirnaeth Arnoediad. Fingon is killed, Turgon becomes High King of the Noldor. Huor dies in the Fen of Serech, Húrin is taken prisoner. Birth of Tuor. Death of Rían.

name: Siege of Brithombar and Eglarest
description: Siege and capture of Brithombar and Eglarest.

name: Birth of Dior Aranel
description: Birth of Dior Aranel.

name: Reforging of Anglachel
description: Anglachel is reforged into Gurthang.

name: Fall of Nargothrond
description: Tuor's arrival in Gondolin. Fall of Nargothrond. In this battle die among others Orodreth and his daughter Finduilas.

name: Túrin marries Niniel
description: Túrin marries Niniel.

name: Death of Glaurung and others
description: Death of Glaurung, Túrin, Hunthor, Dorlas, Brandir and Nienor Niniel in Brethil. Release of Húrin.

name: Death of Mîm and Húrin
description: Húrin comes to Nargothrond and kills Mîm, the last Petty-dwarf. Húrin's death.

name: Dwarves kill Thingol
description: Dwarves kill Thingol. Melian returns to Valinor.

name: Birth of Eärendil and Elwing
description: Birth of Eärendil in Gondolin. Birth of Elwing in Ossiriand.

name: Battle for the Nauglamír
description: Beren wins the Nauglamír with the Silmaril in a battle against the Dwarves. Dior's journey to Doriath.

name: Second death of Beren and Lúthien
description: Second death of Beren and Lúthien. Dior receives the Silmaril.

name: Second Kinslaying
description: Attack of Fëanor's sons on Menegroth. Dior, Celegorm, Curufin and Caranthir die. Elwing, Dior's daughter, escapes with the Silmaril to the Mouths of Sirion.

name: Fall of Gondolin
description: Maeglin betrays the location of Gondolin, Morgoth attacks the city and Gondolin falls. Death of Turgon. Tuor leads Eärendil, Idril and the remaining survivors to the Mouths of Sirion, where they settle.

name: Tuor and Idril sail west
description: Tuor and Idril sail west with their ship Earráme. Eärendil becomes the ruler of the survivors of Doriath and Gondolin. He marries Elwing.

name: Eärendil's quest and birth of the Half-elven
description: Eärendil departs west with his ship Vingilot to ask the Valar in Valinor for support against Morgoth. The Silmaril remains with Elwing. Birth of the Peredhil Elrond and Elros.

name: Third Kinslaying and Eärendil reaches Valinor
description: The four surviving sons of Fëanor kill many survivors of Doriath at the Mouths of Sirion. Amrod and Amras die. The last two sons of Fëanor, Maglor and Maedhros, capture Elros and Elrond. Elwing saves herself and brings the Silmaril to Eärendil with Ulmo's help, who reaches Valinor with his ship Vingilot. The assembled Valar grant him the help he has pleaded for the Elves and Men. Manwë determines that all Half-elves can decide whether they shall become wholly Elves or Men, whereupon Elwing and Eärendil turn to the Elves. Vingilot is lifted into the heavens and steered forever by Eärendil with the Silmaril on his brow: The Morning and Evening Star.

name: War of Wrath
description: War of Wrath and destruction of Beleriand. Angband is destroyed.

name: Death of Maedhros
description: Death of Maedhros. Loss of the Silmarils.

name: End of the First Age
description: Morgoth is cast out from Arda and banished into the Void. Beginning of the Second Age.
